intro: Handroanthus billbergii subsp. billbergii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is part of the Bignoniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture.
